materials.raw_text: Cobalt (C8): 40 g; Terbium (Tb5): 25 g; Technetium (Tc4): 15 g; Thulium (Tm3): 10 g.

sourcing.instructions: Cobalt: Obtain from chemical supply companies or metal suppliers; Terbium: Order from specialized rare earth metal suppliers; Technetium: Acquire from licensed nuclear material suppliers; Thulium: Purchase from rare earth element suppliers.
steps: Cobalt: Obtain from chemical supply companies or metal suppliers; Terbium: Order from specialized rare earth metal suppliers; Technetium: Acquire from licensed nuclear material suppliers; Thulium: Purchase from rare earth element suppliers.

1. Weigh each ingredient using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the weighed Cobalt, Terbium, Technetium, and Thulium. 3. Use a mechanical stirrer to ensure an even distribution of the components for 10 minutes. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a homogenizing mill for an additional 5 minutes to achieve a fine, uniform particle size.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the weighed Cobalt, Terbium, Technetium, and Thulium. 3. Use a mechanical stirrer to ensure an even distribution of the components for 10 minutes. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a homogenizing mill for an additional 5 minutes to achieve a fine, uniform particle size.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200 째C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a ceramic crucible. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to allow for complete fusion of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200 째C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a ceramic crucible. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to allow for complete fusion of the materials.

steps: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down gradually to room temperature (approximately 25 째C). 2. This cooling process should take around 4-6 hours to prevent thermal shock and cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down gradually to room temperature (approximately 25 째C). 2. This cooling process should take around 4-6 hours to prevent thermal shock and cracking.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible carefully. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
